title.rendered: Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom

content.rendered:
Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom – too scary NOT to read!

Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom

Frameworks Consortium

Frameworks Consortium Launches “Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom”. Readers benefit from the collective experience of Frameworks Consortium’s members.

We hope that Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom will inspire business owners to take a more proactive approach to their operations”

— George Mayfield

DALLAS, TEXAS, UNITED STATES, May 3, 2023/EINPresswire.com/ — Frameworks Consortium LLC, a group that helps small and medium-sized businesses achieve success, has announced the upcoming release of Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom, a book written by experienced service providers who want to help business leaders prevent dangerous situations in their own businesses. The book comprises case studies on common issues that business owners struggle with and may sometimes even cause catastrophic business failure – all told with with a horrific, supernatural twist.

The authors of the book are George Mayfield from Frameworks Consortium, Jeff Sandene from Sandene Strategies, Susan Bryant from MB Group, Paul Feather from Compunetics, Eric Harrison from 4Impact Data, Charles Shoultz from C.A. Shoultz, Ieshea Hollins from Direnzic, and Bill Burkhalter from Salesxceleration. These experts provide valuable insights to business leaders while being a source of imaginative entertainment.

The book is designed to help business owners and leaders better understand the risks associated with their operations and provide them with the tools they need to make informed decisions. By consolidating all business objectives under one roof, Frameworks Consortium fills the gap between identifying the need for improvement and taking action to generate momentum for businesses. The C-Suite advisors keep track of monthly metrics to ensure clients are continually progressing.

The monthly CEO Mastermind meetings are an essential part of the Frameworks Consortium membership. The meetings are designed for members to come together and discuss the most pressing topics of the day, network with industry professionals and learn from their experiences. The meetings also provide members with opportunities to collaborate with other members and gain valuable insights into their businesses.

Although the release date has been slated for August 2023, the book will be made available for purchase directly from FrameworksConsortiumPublishing.com and Amazon.com. Readers will find inspiration within these pages and use the strategies outlined to make their own businesses more successful.

Moreover, Frameworks Consortium is planning to hold speaking events upon the book’s release where the authors will be able to deliver even more wisdom to attendees.

“Each chapter of the book provides readers with a case study on a common issue that business owners may face, along with an expert’s perspective on how to avoid or solve such a problem,” said George Mayfield, author, and CEO of Frameworks Consortium. “The stories are designed to be both entertaining and enlightening, with a good dose of practical advice mixed in.”

Each author has contributed insights on different business challenges based on their areas of expertise. For instance, Jeff Sandene’s chapter focuses on business owner wealth strategies, while Paul Feather’s chapter discusses the importance of IT compliance and separation of duties.

“The scariest moments and places in businesses are the places you have to go alone. Don’t go there! Read this book and apply its principles to gain confidence in every challenge you face.”, says Eric Harrison of 4ImpactData. Business owners could use these stories as preventive measures and take necessary steps to avoid similar occurrences from affecting their business. With these insights, companies are better equipped to avoid potential pitfalls and make informed decisions to stay ahead of the curve.

“We hope that Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom will inspire business owners to take a more proactive approach to their operations,” said George Mayfield. “By understanding the possible risks, they can better protect their business and achieve greater success.”

The book is also beneficial to Frameworks Consortium members as they have access to these stories and are in touch with the Vetted Service Providers that authored the book. Members utilize these resources to enhance or mitigate their operations. Frameworks Consortium is adamant on providing businesses an efficient way to improve and scale up without facing the dire situations laid out in the book.

“This book is a fun collection of practical and relatable stories designed to help business owners avoid creating monster problems in their companies.” – Susan Bryant, CPA

As a collective, Frameworks Consortium has hundreds of years of experience helping small and medium-sized businesses reach their potential through a variety of services. The company’s members are experts in business strategy, marketing, IT, HR, and other areas that play an essential role in running a successful company.

Says Bill Burkhalter, sales consultant with Salesxceleration, “Success takes hard work, dedication and a lot of strategic planning. Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom is essential reading for any entrepreneur”.

Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom is expected to become a valuable resource for business leaders, providing insights into common challenges and solutions for avoiding disaster. Frameworks Consortium’s members are well-prepared to help businesses comprehend the issues and setbacks they may encounter and the measures that need to be taken to overcome them. Entrepreneurs interested in expanding their operations or looking for ways to mitigate their business risks can benefit from reading this book.

Looking to contribute your expertise to a groundbreaking book on business challenges and solutions? Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom is your chance to have your insights shared with a global audience. Authored by industry professionals with decades of experience, the book offers practical and proven strategies for overcoming the most pressing issues entrepreneurs face. Whether you’re an expert in marketing, HR, IT or business strategy, your contribution can help businesses succeed and avoid disaster. Join the Frameworks Consortium Publishing team and be part of this game-changing project in future volumes.

Are you an entrepreneur looking for ways to push your business to the next level? Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom – Volume 1 offers practical advice from experts with decades of experience. Get tips on marketing, HR, IT, and more from industry professionals and learn how to avoid common business risks for success. Invest in your business’s success and buy Scary Stories to Tell in the Boardroom today!

George Mayfield
Frameworks Consortium
+1 469-922-3508
info@frameworksconsortium.com
Visit us on social media:
Facebook
LinkedIn

Scary Stories to Tell in The Boardroom by Frameworks Consortium

You just read:

News Provided By

May 03, 2023, 21:18 GMT

As a user, if you see something we have missed, please do bring it to our attention. Your help is welcome. EIN Presswire, Everyone’s Internet News Presswire,
tries to define some of the boundaries that are reasonable in today’s world. Please see our
Editorial Guidelines
for more information.
